meanings.definition: To gather or move in a group, as bees in a hive.
meanings.sent1: The children were hiving around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent2: The bees were hiving together to protect their queen.
meanings.sent3: The students were hiving around the teacher, eager to hear a story.
meanings.sent4: The shoppers were hiving around the sale rack, searching for bargains.
meanings.sent5: The birds were hiving in the trees, chirping happily.

meanings.definition: To store or place in a hive.
meanings.sent1: She was hiving away her collection of stamps in a special album.
meanings.sent2: The beekeeper was hiving the newly collected honey in the apiary.
meanings.sent3: He was hiving his favorite toys in a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was hiving nuts in the hollow of a tree for winter.
meanings.sent5: The chef was hiving spices in labeled jars for easy access.

meanings.definition: To be full of activity or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The stadium was hiving with fans cheering for their team.
meanings.sent2: The city center was hiving with people enjoying the festival.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was hiving with energy before the surprise announcement.
meanings.sent4: The park was hiving with families having picnics and playing games.
meanings.sent5: The market was hiving with vendors selling fresh produce and goods.
